result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Willie Lee Hopkins Sr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Willie Lee Hopkins Sr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court for Willie Lee Hopkins Sr.  Attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a final pre-trial.  Matter remains in trial posture.  Court scheduled a jury status hearing.  State's offer will remain open until the next court date.  Jury Trial remains calendared on November 14, 2022 at 9:00 AM for first call.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Received and Filed: State's Motion in Limine

Defendant Willie Lee Hopkins Sr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court for Willie Lee Hopkins Sr.  Attorney Gerald Henry Alder in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. EXPIRES 11-28-2022. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 2.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Sylvan Jaspen in court, defendant Willie Lee Hopkins not in court, in custody.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
OFF THE RECORD. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Willie Lee Hopkins in court, appear by video with attorney Sylvan Jaspen, appear by video.  Defendant Willie Lee Hopkins in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judical notice to case 17CF450. Sworn for the State: Shorewood Police Officer H. Wolber.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Willie Lee Hopkins in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Willie Lee Hopkins in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Willie Lee Hopkins appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
